intro: Xanthoxalis flagellata, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. Xanthoxalis flagellata is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
